file_content.text: We're done here, Jedi. I'd prefer not to speak again.
Jedi. You're back.
What happened out there? Where's my father?
He's at peace, now. I brought you his ring.
Laid to rest.
This is all that's left of him?
I'm sorry.
What? No....
I have him right here--what's left of him.
In my bags.
This is what's left? His body? His ring?
Those monsters! Tell me you cut them into pieces for what they did.
I went out there to save a man's life--not to satisfy your thirst for blood.
It wasn't about revenge.
So you let those monsters live?
I should be grateful to you for finding out the truth. But you desecrate my father's memory.
Jedi fight for peace, not to kill.
Revenge is wrong.
So far as I can see, Jedi fight for nothing.
Mourn your father and move on, before anger consumes you.
Don't become obsessed.
I don't need your counsel, Jedi.
A pity I couldn't do more.
This isn't what I was hoping for either.
Not very grateful, are you?
Of course. I killed them all; it was what had to happen.
They're all dead.
I'm glad some Jedi are willing to take a stand. Some of you understand that not all creatures deserve to live.
I wanted my father back. I didn't really believe it would happen. But at least you went out there for a reason. At least you spilled blood.
Find peace, knowing that your father's been avenged.
Rest easy.
May the Force protect you and your people.
Be well.
Thank you for all your efforts. If only we could kill every Flesh Raider so easily.
Of course.
How very pointless.
You're more despicable than I imagined.
Leave me to grieve. We won't speak again.
Why are we talking? Find my father and kill the Flesh Raiders who hold him!
You're too late, Jedi--like all the other times. The Flesh Raiders already came. They already took their victims.
Where did this happen? How long ago?
The Flesh Raiders attacked?
What?
Our patrol was attacked. Just yesterday, in the valleys... by the same savages who always attack.
Don't tell me I missed a fight!
Sounds like a party.
This is entertaining to you? Our patrol was attacked!
We can hardly leave the village without running into Flesh Raiders. There's not a scout in Kalikori without a blaster burn or two--and now my father's out there.
What do you mean? Was he with your patrol?
Your father?
How can I assist?
I don't know. It hasn't been long. If the fates have been kind--very kind....
You should learn to watch over your family better.
That makes you a bad son.
If the Flesh Raiders came after your temple, you wouldn't be so callous.
My father knew these mountains. He helped guide the patrols when he could. But when the Flesh Raiders appeared... he never made it home.
He wasn't young, but he deserves better than to be ripped apart. Show compassion, Jedi--find him, and kill any Raiders who'd stop you.
I'll do everything I can to find your father.
Whatever I can do to help.
I'd prefer to negotiate, if possible. But I will find your father.
Killing is a last resort.
You can't talk to Flesh Raiders, Jedi. They don't think like people. They're only interested in blood.
I'm not sure if the Jedi should intervene, here.
Is this Jedi business?
I'm just a Padawan--I'm not sure if I should intervene.
Is this Jedi business?
It's your battle, not mine.
There's that Jedi cruelty. You claim to be good and noble, but you'd rather let a man die than expend effort.
I'm sorry. I'll look for your father--but I can't promise anything.
Very well.
Be well, then--but more important, be quick. Please.
I do enjoy killing Flesh Raiders; I'll think it over.
The violence might be fun.
Then while you're thinking, I'll listen to the echoes of my father's screams.
If you find him--if he's hurt or confused--you'll know him by his golden promise ring. He wouldn't part with it... not until death.
I'm busy. [Refuse quest]
Then don't waste my time, and don't raise my hopes.
You can do nothing for me now.
